7. Implications
7.1 Implications for programmes: limitations and caveats
The role of individual interventions in improving child nutrition was discussed in Part I  of this 
document. Efficacy in terms of, for example, counselling changing breastfeeding practices, is 
well understood. The impact of these changes on child health and development outcomes, while 
covered in fewer studies, is reasonably well established. Bhutta and colleagues ( 11) provide 
an imp
